name: Ajwain Water
description: A digestive aid to relieve gas, indigestion, and stomach pain.
preparationMethod: Boil 1 cup of water.
Add ajwain seeds.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Strain and serve warm.
benefits: Improves digestion, relieves gas, reduces bloating.
precautions: Avoid excessive use during pregnancy.

name: Turmeric Milk
description: A natural anti-inflammatory and immunity booster.
preparationMethod: Heat the milk.
Add turmeric and stir well.
Simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve warm.
benefits: Boosts immunity, reduces inflammation, aids sleep.
precautions: Avoid in case of turmeric allergy.

name: Ginger Tea
description: A warming tea that helps relieve cold symptoms and nausea.
preparationMethod: Boil water with sliced ginger.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Strain and add honey if desired.
benefits: Reduces nausea, eases congestion, anti-inflammatory.
precautions: May interfere with blood thinners.

name: Tulsi Leaves
description: Holy basil known for its immune-boosting and stress-relieving properties.
preparationMethod: Boil tulsi leaves in water for 5 minutes.
Strain and drink warm.
benefits: Fights infection, reduces stress, purifies blood.
precautions: Consult before use during pregnancy.

name: Cinnamon Water
description: Helps regulate blood sugar and improve heart health.
preparationMethod: Boil cinnamon in water for 10 minutes.
Strain and drink warm.
benefits: Lowers blood sugar, reduces cholesterol, anti-inflammatory.
precautions: Limit to one stick daily.

name: Amla Juice
description: Rich in Vitamin C, boosts immunity and strengthens hair.
preparationMethod: Mix amla juice with water.
Consume on empty stomach.
benefits: Improves digestion, skin health, and immunity.
precautions: May cause acidity in excess.

name: Jeera Water
description: Cumin water improves digestion and detoxifies the body.
preparationMethod: Boil water with cumin seeds for 5 minutes.
Strain and drink warm.
benefits: Aids digestion, flushes toxins, relieves gas.
precautions: Avoid overuse in low blood sugar patients.

name: Neem Leaves
description: Neem purifies blood and is effective in treating skin problems.
preparationMethod: Boil neem leaves in water for 10 minutes.
Strain and consume or use as a skin rinse.
benefits: Cleanses blood, treats acne, boosts immunity.
precautions: Avoid during pregnancy.

name: Flaxseed Drink
description: A fiber-rich drink that supports digestion and helps lower cholesterol.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil flaxseeds in water for 5â€“7 minutes until it thickens.
2. Strain into a cup.
3. Add lemon juice if desired and stir well.
dosage: Once daily, preferably in the morning.
benefits: Improves bowel movements, rich in omega-3, supports heart health.
precautions: Avoid in cases of bowel obstruction or during pregnancy without medical advice.

name: Fenugreek Tea
description: An herbal tea made from fenugreek seeds to support blood sugar levels.
preparationMethod: 1. Soak fenugreek seeds overnight.
2. Boil the soaked seeds in 1 cup of water.
3. Strain and drink warm.
dosage: 1 cup on an empty stomach in the morning.
benefits: Helps manage blood sugar, aids digestion.
precautions: May lower blood sugar significantly. Monitor closely if diabetic.

name: Mint Juice
description: A cooling remedy for digestion and bowel comfort.
preparationMethod: 1. Blend mint leaves with water.
2. Strain and add black salt.
3. Serve chilled.
benefits: Soothes digestion, relieves nausea, helps IBS symptoms.
precautions: Avoid if you have acid reflux or GERD.

name: Onion Juice for Hair
description: Onion juice stimulates hair growth and reduces scalp infections.
preparationMethod: 1. Peel and grate the onion.
2. Extract juice using a muslin cloth.
3. Apply to scalp and leave for 30 minutes.
4. Wash with mild shampoo.
benefits: Reduces hair fall, nourishes scalp, promotes hair regrowth.
precautions: Avoid contact with eyes. Do a patch test before full use.

name: Coriander Seed Water
description: A soothing herbal drink made from coriander seeds to improve digestion and reduce acidity.
preparationMethod: 1. Soak coriander seeds overnight in water.
2. Boil the soaked seeds in the same water for 10 minutes.
3. Strain and drink warm or at room temperature.
dosage: 1 cup on an empty stomach in the morning.
benefits: Relieves acidity, improves appetite, detoxifies the body.
precautions: Use in moderation if you have low blood pressure.

name: Triphala Powder Drink
description: Triphala is an Ayurvedic formulation to promote healthy digestion.
preparationMethod: 1. Mix triphala powder in warm water.
2. Stir and drink on an empty stomach.
benefits: Improves digestion, relieves constipation, detoxifies body.
precautions: Do not use during pregnancy.

name: Barley Water
disease: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI), Kidney Health, Dehydration
description: A cooling and hydrating drink traditionally used to cleanse the urinary system and support kidney function.
preparationMethod: 1. Wash barley thoroughly.
2. Boil with 4 cups of water for 30â€“40 minutes.
3. Strain and let it cool.
4. Add lemon juice or honey if desired.
benefits: Flushes toxins, supports kidney health, cools the body.
precautions: Consume in moderation if you have gluten sensitivity or low blood pressure.

name: Garlic Clove
description: A simple and powerful heart health booster.
preparationMethod: 1. Peel and crush a garlic clove.
2. Consume raw on an empty stomach.
benefits: Lowers blood pressure and cholesterol levels.
precautions: May irritate stomach lining if taken excessively.

name: Holy Basil (Tulsi) Tea
description: A sacred herb tea to calm the mind and support the lungs.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil tulsi leaves in water for 5 minutes.
2. Strain and serve warm.
benefits: Reduces stress, clears respiratory tract, enhances immunity.
precautions: Avoid during pregnancy without doctorâ€™s advice.

name: Licorice Root Tea
description: A sweet-tasting root tea for respiratory relief.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil water and add licorice root.
2. Simmer for 10 minutes.
3. Strain and drink warm.
benefits: Soothes throat, reduces inflammation, clears mucus.
precautions: Not for long-term use; avoid if you have high blood pressure.

name: Black Raisin Water
description: A powerful detox and iron-rich drink made by soaking black raisins overnight.
preparationMethod: 1. Soak black raisins in water overnight.
2. In the morning, strain the water and drink on an empty stomach.
3. Eat the soaked raisins separately if desired.
benefits: Boosts iron levels, supports liver health, balances hormones.
precautions: Use in moderation if diabetic due to natural sugar content.

name: Coriander Tea
description: A soothing tea that helps reduce acidity and bloating.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil coriander seeds in water for 5â€“7 minutes.
2. Strain and serve warm.
benefits: Relieves heartburn, aids digestion.
precautions: Not recommended in large doses during pregnancy.

name: Peppermint Tea
description: A calming tea known to relieve nausea and bloating.
preparationMethod: 1. Steep peppermint leaves or tea bag in hot water for 5 minutes.
2. Strain and serve.
benefits: Eases stomach pain, reduces bloating.
precautions: Avoid if suffering from acid reflux.

name: Ashwagandha Tonic
description: An adaptogenic herb to combat stress and fatigue.
preparationMethod: 1. Mix ashwagandha powder into warm milk.
2. Stir well and drink before bed.
benefits: Reduces stress, improves energy, boosts immunity.
precautions: Consult doctor before use if on medication.

name: Lemon Honey Water
description: A refreshing morning drink to boost metabolism and digestion.
preparationMethod: 1. Mix lemon juice and honey into warm water.
2. Stir and drink immediately.
dosage: Every morning on an empty stomach.
benefits: Flushes toxins, aids digestion, boosts energy.
precautions: Not for people with citrus allergies.

name: Brahmi Tea
description: Brahmi is an Ayurvedic herb known for cognitive support.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil Brahmi leaves in water for 7 minutes.
2. Strain and drink warm.
benefits: Improves memory, reduces stress, enhances clarity.
precautions: May cause drowsiness if consumed in excess.

name: Clove Infused Water
description: Clove water helps in oral care and boosts digestive health.
preparationMethod: 1. Boil cloves in water for 5 minutes.
2. Strain and cool slightly before drinking or using as mouth rinse.
dosage: Once daily or as a rinse after brushing.
benefits: Fights bacteria, freshens breath, reduces inflammation.
precautions: Avoid overuse as it may cause mouth irritation.

name: Carrot Juice
description: Rich in beta-carotene, carrot juice supports eye and skin health.
preparationMethod: 1. Blend carrots with water until smooth.
2. Strain or drink as is.
benefits: Improves eyesight, boosts skin glow, detoxifies liver.
precautions: May cause orange skin tone in excessive amounts.

name: Beetroot Juice
description: Beetroot increases red blood cell production and lowers BP.
preparationMethod: 1. Peel and chop beetroot.
2. Blend with water and strain.
3. Add lemon for flavor if needed.
benefits: Boosts hemoglobin, improves stamina, lowers blood pressure.
precautions: May turn urine and stools red temporarily.

name: Curry Leaves Juice
description: Curry leaves help in reducing hair fall and improving iron levels.
preparationMethod: 1. Blend curry leaves with water.
2. Strain and add lemon juice if desired.
3. Drink fresh.
benefits: Strengthens hair roots, rich in iron and antioxidants.
precautions: May taste bitter; adjust with lemon or honey.

name: Raw Potato Juice
description: Raw potato juice is used for treating gastritis and reducing inflammation.
preparationMethod: 1. Wash and peel the potato.
2. Grate and extract juice using cheesecloth.
3. Drink immediately on an empty stomach.
benefits: Neutralizes acidity, supports gut health, anti-inflammatory.
precautions: Avoid green or sprouted potatoes.

name: Coconut Oil Pulling
description: An ancient Ayurvedic practice for detoxifying the mouth and improving oral health.
preparationMethod: 1. Take 1 tablespoon of coconut oil in your mouth.
2. Swish it around for 10â€“15 minutes without swallowing.
3. Spit it out and rinse with warm water.
benefits: Reduces bacteria, whitens teeth, freshens breath.
precautions: Do not swallow the oil.
